p: Most patients (80.4%) were children less than 2 years of age. There were no significant differences in demographic characteristics between those with severe and non-severe disease. There were 7 patients with underlying co-morbidities: 3 with congenital heart disease, 3 with neurological disease and 1 patient with achondroplasia. Patients in the severe group had a significantly longer duration of hospitalisation (p<0.001, z = -5.62).
